snippet: Captive insurance companies can save money on premiums, reduce income taxes and transfer money to heirs free of estate taxes, but they also carry the potential for abuse.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column investigates the merits of captive insurance companies, private insurers that are wholly owned subsidiaries of another company; contends that captives can save money on premiums, reduce income taxes and transfer money to heirs free of estate taxes, but they also carry the potential for abuse.
lead_paragraph: Captive insurance companies can save money on premiums, reduce income taxes and transfer money to heirs free of estate taxes, but they also carry the potential for abuse.
